cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T.3172
OPERATIONS.
SECRET.
From :- General Delme Radcliffe, Italy.
To :- C.I.G.S., War Office.
Despatched 2.40 a.m.)
) 2/1/18.
Received 3.30 a.m. )
10089 January 1st. Evening.
3rd Army. After Zenson Bridgehead had been subjected to severe concentrations of artillery fire by Italians, enemy abandoned right bank of Piave during night of December 31st January 1st leaving material and many dead.
4th Army. Artillery activity along the whole front. 3rd Corps. Nothing of importance to report. Aerial activity. Day of December 30th Italian machines bombed enemy aerodromes between S. Fior and Godega Di S. Urano. They dropped 210 bombs. Two machines failed to return. On December 30th December 31st three enemy machines were brought down. On night of December 30th Italians bombed enemy aviation grounds at Aviano and La Comina. 48 bombs were dropped. Night of December 31st enemy carried out raids on Vicenza Cittadella Bassano Gastelfranco Mestre and Istrana. Damage is reported to be light.
